mass.title: Daily Meditation
mass.noDataWeekday: Weekday meditation information is currently being prepared
mass.bibleNotice: â€»Please listen to the Bible text at church or read an official Bible.
mass.contentDisclaimer: This content does not replace the official Mass liturgy and is provided as guidance and meditation material to support your faith life.

prayer.title: Meditation Guide

morning.title: Morning Meditation
morning.subtitle: Morning
morning.content: A time to thank God at the beginning of the day and entrust the new day under God's protection. When you wake up and start your day, this is a time to ask for God's grace and protection throughout the day.

meal.title: Meal Meditation
meal.subtitle: Meal
meal.content: A time to thank God for the food before and after meals. Before the meal, thank God for providing food, and after the meal, thank God for being full.

evening.title: Evening Meditation
evening.subtitle: Evening
evening.content: A time to thank God at the end of the day, repent of the day's sins, and ask for forgiveness. Before going to bed, reflect on the day and pray for tomorrow.

difficult.title: Meditation in Difficult Times
difficult.subtitle: In Difficult Times
difficult.content: A time to ask for God's help and comfort in difficult situations or times of suffering. Even in trials and hardships, this is a time to believe in God's love and protection.

thanksgiving.title: Thanksgiving Meditation
thanksgiving.subtitle: Thanksgiving
thanksgiving.content: A time to thank God for the grace and blessings He has given. This is a time to have a heart of gratitude for everything, from small daily joys to great blessings.

meditation.title: Meditation Time
meditation.subtitle: Meditation Time
meditation.content: A time to have quiet time, dialogue with God, and reflect on your heart. Meditate on the Word and spend peaceful time seeking God's will.

repentance.title: Repentance Meditation
repentance.subtitle: Repentance
repentance.content: A time to acknowledge your sins before God and repent. Ask for forgiveness, seek God's grace, and resolve to repent with a new heart and live according to God's will.

peace.title: Peace Meditation
peace.subtitle: Peace
peace.content: A time to seek God's peace and find rest for your heart. Entrust your worries and anxieties to God, pray that the Lord's peace may dwell in your heart, and find a calm mind.

forgiveness.title: Forgiveness Meditation
forgiveness.subtitle: Forgiveness
forgiveness.content: A time to forgive others and be forgiven. Entrust your wounded heart to God, pray to have a forgiving heart, and forgive others as God has forgiven us.

love.title: Love Meditation
love.subtitle: Love
love.content: A time to meditate on God's love and practice love. Love your neighbor as God has loved us, and find ways to practice love in daily life.

patience.title: Patience Meditation
patience.subtitle: Patience
patience.content: A time to cultivate the virtue of patience and learn to wait. Be patient even in difficult situations, wait for God's timing, and pray to bear the fruit of patience.

waiting.title: Waiting Meditation
waiting.subtitle: Waiting
waiting.content: A time to wait for God's timing and be patient. Trust in God's plans rather than your own, make waiting time a time to draw closer to God, and wait for God's response.

meditationGuides.gospel: Meditation on the Word of Scripture (Gospel)

prayer.permissionDenied: Permission denied. Please check your login status.

meditationTips.title: How to Meditate
meditationTips.subtitle: Meditation Guide
meditationTips.content:
1. Choose a Quiet Place
Select a quiet place where you won't be disturbed.

2. Comfortable Posture
Sit comfortably, either in a chair or kneeling position.

3. Read Scripture
Slowly read today's Bible passage.

4. Meditate
Reflect on the meaning of the passage and consider questions you'd like to ask God.

5. Pray
Open your heart to God and spend time in conversation.

6. Act
Apply what you've learned from meditation to your daily life.

practicalTips.title: Practical Meditation Tips
practicalTips.subtitle: Helpful Tips
practicalTips.content:
â€¢ Meditating at the same time each day is helpful.
â€¢ Consistency is more important than duration (10-15 minutes is fine).
â€¢ Write down thoughts and feelings that arise during meditation.
â€¢ You can meditate while listening to quiet music or nature sounds.
â€¢ Reading Bible verses aloud can also be beneficial.
â€¢ End your meditation with a brief prayer.

meditationJournal.title: Keeping a Meditation Journal
meditationJournal.subtitle: Meditation Journal
meditationJournal.content:
A meditation journal is a great way to record your conversations with God.

â€¢ Write down the Bible passage you read today
â€¢ Note any insights or questions that came to mind during meditation
â€¢ Record your prayers to God and His responses
â€¢ Organize what you want to apply to your daily life
â€¢ Write down things you're grateful for or prayer topics

Through your journal, you can see how your relationship with God is growing.

prayerAfterMeditation.title: Prayer After Meditation
prayerAfterMeditation.subtitle: Closing Prayer
prayerAfterMeditation.content:
After meditation, pray like this:

"Lord, thank you for the teaching you gave me through today's word. Help me to put this insight into practice in my daily life. Guide me to live according to your will. May I live this day protected in your love, and help me to share that love with others. Amen."
